author: radekkapka
content: Hey guys, the https://ethereum.github.io/eth2.0-APIs/#/Node/getNetworkIdentity endpoint contains a `discovery_addresses` field, which is an array. As far as I understand, a single node will always have a single discovery address. Is there a specific reason why this is modelled as an array? Consistency with `p2p_addresses`?

author: jgm
content: There could be multiple addresses.  Either different interfaces (physical or logical), or different protocols (ip4 and ip6)
